MODULE.name: DPX
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The DPX (Document Processing eXtensions) is a software solution that enables customers to extract and process various types of information from documents. A single document may contain barcodes, text, image data and forms, using DPX this data can be extracted programmatically using OCR, barcode decoding and image capture. For example, a driver's license can be thought of as a template containing regions such as name and address, signature and photo, each of these regions are processed and returned to RhoElements separately by DPX so Optical Character Recognition captures the owners name and address whilst their photo is captured separately. These regions are defined by a template which maps the various regions of the document to the data they contain and can be created online at [The MSI DPX template builder](https://dpx.motorolasolutions.com/)
MODULE.MORE_HELP:
## Enabling the API In order to use this API you must include the following extension in your `build.yml` :::ruby extensions: ["dpx"]
The `dpx` extension is also included automatically if you specify the following in your `build.yml` :::ruby app_type: "rhoelements"
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript
## Ruby Usage Be sure to review the [Ruby API Usage](/guide/api_ruby) guide for important information about using this API in Ruby

PROPERTIES.DESC: These properties are used to configure how the DPX works, for example how feedback is provided to the user

PROPERTY.name: template
PROPERTY.DESC: The template XML which defines the document to be processed. This should be the full path to the template on the device. You must provide this property to define the form being captured and what is contained in each region on that form. Templates are specific to each document format you intend on capturing and can be created online at https://dpx.motorolasolutions.com/.

PROPERTY.name: audioFeedback
PROPERTY.DESC: Whether or not to provide audio feedback to the user following document processing

PROPERTY.name: debug
PROPERTY.DESC: If enabled, allows a session to write form capture, region images, region values, and other data to storage.

PROPERTY.name: hapticFeedback
PROPERTY.DESC: Whether or not to provide haptic feedback to the user following document processing

PROPERTY.name: ledFeedback
PROPERTY.DESC: Whether or not to provide LED feedback to the user following document processing

PROPERTY.name: fileInteractiveMode
PROPERTY.DESC: Determine whether to load file interactively (true) or via inputSourceFilename parameter (false).

VALUE.DESC: Turn flash off.
Set auto flash.
Turn flash on.

PROPERTY.name: identificationTimeout
PROPERTY.DESC: The length of time, in milliseconds, that the processing engine has to recognise the image from the provided template. From 0 to 20000 step by 100.

PROPERTY.name: inputSource
PROPERTY.DESC: Defines where the document should be captured from, either the device camera or a file.

VALUE.DESC: The document will be captured from the device camera. After calling the captureDocument method the camera preview will be presented, the user should place the document to be captured in the preview frame and press the soft button to capture & process the image.
The document will be captured from the device imager.
The document to be captured is given as an image file. If you specify the inputSource as file you must also specify the inputSourceFilename property.

PROPERTY.name: inputSourceFilename
PROPERTY.DESC: This parameter is mandatory if you have specified the inputSource as 'file' but unnecessary if the document is being captured by the device camera. This is the full path to the image to be processed.

PROPERTY.name: logDirectory
PROPERTY.DESC: Specify which directory to search for logs in.

PROPERTY.name: manualResolution
PROPERTY.DESC: Set the image size to use if manual resolution selection is used.

PROPERTY.name: manualResolutionMode
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies whether to choose image resolution automatically (false) or manually (true).

PROPERTY.name: ocrLanguage
PROPERTY.DESC: Switch between English and European language.

VALUE.DESC: English characters only.
Include European language characters.

PROPERTY.name: processingTimeout
PROPERTY.DESC: Amount of time in milliseconds to wait before timing out processing.

PROPERTY.name: userMode
PROPERTY.DESC: Defines which user mode to use when acquiring an image. Only valid for Input Source is camera.

VALUE.DESC: Viewfinder preview feed.
Camera image capture.

PROPERTY.name: uiResultConfirmation
PROPERTY.DESC: If enabled, shows a UI confirmation with results in DPXView before sending results back to application.

PROPERTY.name: zoomAmount
PROPERTY.DESC: Amount for the camera to zoom in by. 0 denotes no zoom, 100 denotes max zoom.

METHOD.name: init
METHOD.DESC: Opens the input source that is currently set.

CALLBACK.DESC: DPX engine calls the callback on any significant event. Look at callbackType parameter.

PARAM.name: callbackType
PARAM.DESC: Indicates whether the document was decoded successfully or not.

VALUE.DESC: The document was decoded and processed successfully and this callback contains information about the processed form. Look at processedForm parameter.
An error has occured whilst processing the document. Look at failure parameter.

PARAM.name: failureReason
PARAM.DESC: Describes reason for failure.

VALUE.DESC: DPX engine generic error.
Identification timeout. Refer to identificationTimeout property.
Processing timeout. Refer to processingTimeout property.

PARAM.DESC: The name of the region, as defined in the template associated with the document.

PARAM.DESC: The number of the region, as defined in the template section associated with the recognised region.

PARAM.DESC: The type of region which has been decoded.

VALUE.DESC: Optical Character Recognition. The region is a text field. The processedData parameter contains array of lines.
Optical Mark Recognition. The region is a check box or radio box. The processedData paramater of this callback will contain boolean value.

The region is a barcode and the decoded barcode data is given in the processedData parameter.

PARAM.name: processedData
PARAM.DESC: The processed data contained in the specified region, this will depend on the type of region being captured. See values of processingMode parameter.

PARAM.DESC: The image of region.

PARAM.DESC: Width of region in pixels.

PARAM.name: height
PARAM.DESC: Height of region in pixels.

PARAM.name: id
PARAM.DESC: Id of region image. Use getDataUri method to retrieve image data. Id is valid until close method is called.

PARAM.name: relativeOcrConfidence
PARAM.DESC: Relative OCR confidence for processed data if applicable.

PARAM.name: absoluteOcrConfidence
PARAM.DESC: Absolute OCR confidence for processed data if applicable.

METHOD.name: captureDocument
METHOD.DESC: Capture a document by either taking a photo of it or providing an image and process that image for fields defined in the template. You must specify the template associated with the capture either through the template property or as part of the propertyMap when calling this method. If the document processing does not succeed the returned callback will contain either 'error' or 'timeout' in the callback type field. If the captured document is processed successfully a callback will be fired once for each field defined in your template

METHOD.name: getDataUri
METHOD.DESC: Return data URI encoding of the raw image assocated with the region or captured form, this allows the operator to easily verify that the captured data is accurate and if necessary perform any post processing changes by hand. To show image on HTML page insert data URI in src attribute of img tag: .

PARAM.name: imageId
PARAM.DESC: Id of image to retrieve. Ids are valid until close method call.

METHOD.name: close
METHOD.DESC: Close DPX engine, and release allocated resources.
